last_episode_to_air.name: The Finals
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Final four teams, made up of the best ninja athletes, will battle on the side by side course, and one will be crowned Ninja vs Ninja Champion.

name: American Ninja Warrior: Ninja vs. Ninja
original_name: American Ninja Warrior: Ninja vs. Ninja
overview: American Ninja Warrior: Ninja vs. Ninja is a U.S. reality TV sports television game show about obstacle racing based on obstacle courses of the type found in the SASUKE TV franchise. Formerly titled as Team Ninja Warrior, it was spun-off by A. Smith & Co. from their American Ninja Warrior TV series.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: The first season of American Team Ninja Warrior occurred in the 2015-2016 TV season. The season was taped from October 21–23, 2015, in Long Beach, California. Of the competing teams, only one team was captained by a woman, that of Jessie Graff's, the "G-Force". Premiering on January 19, 2016, the season consisted of eight, hour-long episodes, exclusively on Esquire Network. The season ended with "Party Time", consisting of members Brian Arnold, Jake Murray, and Jennifer Tavernier crowned Team Ninja Warrior Champions, winning over "TNT", which included members Travis Rosen, Adam Arnold, and Joyce Shahboz.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: The second season of Team American Ninja Warrior premiered on USA Network on April 18, 2017, with the season finale airing June 27, 2017. There were 28 teams; unlike season 1, in which only one team was captained by a woman, season 2 featured 3 teams captained by women. The season ended with Storm Team, led by Joe Moravsky, being crowned as the new champions, with Travis Rosen's Team TNT finishing runner-up for the second year in a row.

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 1
episodes.overview: Past "Warrior" competitors race head-to-head on the mother of all obstacle courses.

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 2
episodes.overview: In the second week of competition, David Campbell's NorCal Ninjas take on a powerhouse team featuring Ian Dory and Meagan Martin.

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 3
episodes.overview: The third qualifying episode features Brent Steffensen and Kacy Catanzaro on Team Alpha. Other captains are Kevin Bull, leading The Expendabulls, plus Ryan Stratis and his team, Stratisfaction, along with Tremayne Dortch, and the Tre Amigoz.

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 4
episodes.overview: Flip Rodriguez, and "the Cowboy Ninja", Lance Pekus lead two of the top teams in the fourth week of competition. Another strong group of ninja superstars competes in the fourth qualifying episode - led by Flip Rodriguez and his "Team Ronin". Lance Pekus is captain of "The Wild Bunch". Noah Kaufmann leads "The Think Tank", and Karson Voiles' team is called "Karsonic Boom".

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 5
episodes.overview: Top Ninjas Geoff Britten, Elet Hall and Michelle Warnky are a few of the stars competing in the fifth qualifying week.

episodes.name: Qualifying Week 6
episodes.overview: Ninja superstars Brian Arnold, Drew Drechsel, Jamie Rahn, and Abel Gonzalez lead their teams in this final qualifying episode, with the winner moving on to the Series Finals.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview: The first season of American Team Ninja Warrior occurred in the 2015-2016 TV season. The season was taped from October 21–23, 2015, in Long Beach, California. Of the competing teams, only one team was captained by a woman, that of Jessie Graff's, the "G-Force". Premiering on January 19, 2016, the season consisted of eight, hour-long episodes, exclusively on Esquire Network. The season ended with "Party Time", consisting of members Brian Arnold, Jake Murray, and Jennifer Tavernier crowned Team Ninja Warrior Champions, winning over "TNT", which included members Travis Rosen, Adam Arnold, and Joyce Shahboz.

2.overview: The second season of Team American Ninja Warrior premiered on USA Network on April 18, 2017, with the season finale airing June 27, 2017. There were 28 teams; unlike season 1, in which only one team was captained by a woman, season 2 featured 3 teams captained by women. The season ended with Storm Team, led by Joe Moravsky, being crowned as the new champions, with Travis Rosen's Team TNT finishing runner-up for the second year in a row.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 1
episodes.overview: Featuring ninja superstars Meagan Martin and Flip Rodriguez.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 2
episodes.overview: The Cowboy Ninja Lance Pekus and Jesse "Flex" Labreck lead their teams on the side-by-side course.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 3
episodes.overview: A team made up of U.S. Olympians takes on the course, along with top female competitor Barclay Stockett.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 4
episodes.overview: Four teams of Ninja superstars battle on the side by side course, including top climber Ian Dory and David "The Godfather" Campbell.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 5
episodes.overview: Grant "The Island Ninja" McCartney and other popular Ninja athletes race side by side on a double obstacle course.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 6
episodes.overview: Ninja legends Brent Steffensen and Michelle Warnky join other superstar athletes racing on the side-by-side obstacle course.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 7
episodes.overview: Top ninja athletes Daniel Gil and Kevin Bull captain their teams in this side-by-side obstacle course competition.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 8
episodes.overview: Travis Rosen and "The Phoenix" Najee Richardson join other ninja stars racing on the side-by-side obstacle course.

episodes.name: Qualifying Episode 9
episodes.overview: "Superhero" Jamie Rahn and "The Papal Ninja" Sean Bryan lead their teams into battle on a challenging two-lane obstacle course.

episodes.name: Wild Card Episode 1
episodes.overview: Non-winning teams from the qualifying rounds compete for a wild-card spot in the next round.

episodes.name: Wild Card Episode 2
episodes.overview: Non-winning teams from the qualifying rounds compete for a wild-card spot in the next round.

episodes.name: Playoffs Episode 1
episodes.overview: The Playoffs begin as four teams, made up of top ninja athletes, battle for one spot in the Finals

episodes.name: Playoffs Episode 2
episodes.overview: Four teams made up of ninja superstars will battle for one spot in the Ninja vs Ninja Championship.

episodes.name: Playoffs 4
episodes.overview: Four teams battle for one of the spots in the finals.

episodes.name: The Finals
episodes.overview: The Final four teams, made up of the best ninja athletes, will battle on the side by side course, and one will be crowned Ninja vs Ninja Champion.
